name: hadoop

mapreduce/data/container.description: The cloud storage location where the data file will be saved to or restored from. For Amazon S3, use the bucket name. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use the container name.

mapreduce/command.description:
Hadoop Command to run MapReduce.  Example: bin/hadoop jar 
   /root/mapreduce/wordcount.jar org.myorg.MyMapReduce input output

mapreduce/data/output_prefix.display_name: Prefix of output file name to upload
mapreduce/data/output_prefix.description: The prifix of the output filename.  Should be a .tar.gz file

hadoop/namenode/address/port.description: Set the firewall port used by the namenode

mapreduce/data/prefix.display_name: Data file name prefix to download
mapreduce/data/prefix.description: The name that will be used to name/locate the data file.  Should be a .tar.gz file

mapreduce/data/storage_account_id.description: In order to download the data file to the specified cloud storage location, you need to provide cloud authentication credentials. For Amazon S3, use your Amazon access key ID (e.g., cred:AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID). For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace login username (e.g., cred:RACKSPACE_USERNAME).

mapreduce/name.description: Hadoop MapReduce program name.  Example:  MyMapReduce

mapreduce/destination.display_name: Location of jar file for Hadoop Map Reduce command
mapreduce/destination.description: Location where data file will be placed.

hadoop/datanode/ipc/port.description: Set the firewall port used by the datanode ipc address

hadoop/node/type.description: Hadoop node type, used for managing slaves and masters

mapreduce/data/storage_account_secret.description: In order to get the data file to the specified cloud storage location, you will need to provide cloud authentication credentials. For Amazon S3, use your AWS secret access key (e.g., cred:AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY). For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace account API key (e.g., cred:RACKSPACE_AUTH_KEY).

hadoop/datanode/http/port.description: Set the firewall port used by the datanode http server

mapreduce/compile.description:
Command to compile java code.  Example: javac -classpath 
 /home/hadoop/hadoop-core-1.0.3.jar -d wordcount_classes WordCount.java

mapreduce/output.description: Output directory to place data after job is done.

rightscale/public_ssh_key.description:
Hadoop needs a public ssh key which it can use to ssh to 
systems in it's cluster. This key should also match the private key supplied in ssh/private_ssh_key

mapreduce/cleanup.display_name: Delete the destination and Hadoop input/output directories

hadoop/datanode/address/port.description: Set the firewall port used by the datanode address

mapreduce/data/storage_account_provider.description: Location where the data file will be retrieved from. Used by dump recipes to back up to Amazon S3 or Rackspace Cloud Files.

hadoop/namenode/http/port.description: Set the firewall port used by the namenode http server

long_description:
Description
===========
Install and Configure Apache Hadoop 1.03

Requirements
============
Java


Attributes
==========

Usage
=====

To create a Hadoop Cluster, create multiple servers.  Each server will be 
designated as a namenode (master) or datanode (slave).  

Set the hadoop/dfs/replication input to the size of your datanode replication size.

recipes.hadoop::do_map_reduce: Run MapReduce command.  command and uploads output to cloud provider.
recipes.hadoop::do_data_import: Download data from a cloud provider and copy it into the hadoop FS.
recipes.hadoop::do_cleanup: Remove working directories and mapreduce input/output directories
